title: The Best Investment Since 1926? Apple
summary: Apple has generated more wealth for shareholders than any other of the top 50 companies, which account for 40 percent of stock market wealth.

title: Deals in Code, Arrests in Raids: The Risky Stakes of Oil Middlemen
summary: A go-to agent in a lucrative industry that depends on global connections speaks up about allegations that it earned millions through graft.

title: Brazil Offshore Oil Drilling Rights Draw Interest at Auction
summary: The bidding, the first of nine rounds, was considered a test of confidence in government policy as well as the industry’s appetite for exploration.

title: Chevron Names New Chief, Signaling Steady Path
summary: Michael K. Wirth, with experience in pipelines and refineries, will succeed John S. Watson at a time when the company’s shares have bounced back.

title: Why Public Health Insurance Could Help, Even if You Don’t Want It
summary: A public option could put competitive pressure on private health insurers. Markets in India and Mexico show how that might work in the United States.

title: What’s Up in Coal Country: Alternative-Energy Jobs
summary: Miners may have just the skills for scaling wind towers and putting solar panels on roofs. And that’s no small thing in Wyoming and West Virginia.

title: Major Canadian Pipeline Project Is Abandoned
summary: TransCanada, the company behind the Keystone XL pipeline in the United States, dropped plans to connect Eastern Canada with Alberta’s oil sands.

title: Global Economy’s Stubborn Reality: Plenty of Work, Not Enough Pay
summary: Even as job markets are tight in many major economies, low unemployment is failing to spur robust increases in wages, leaving workers angry.

title: The Economy Is Humming. Bankers Are Cheering. What Could Go Wrong?
summary: As global policy makers meet in Washington for the International Monetary Fund’s biannual meetings, the global economy is thriving.

title: China Hastens the World Toward an Electric-Car Future
summary: The biggest automakers in the world are being forced to follow Beijing’s lead as China takes steps to dominate in electric vehicles and technology.

title: Saudi Arabia Detains Critics as New Crown Prince Consolidates Power
summary: The kingdom has arrested 16 people — including clerics, scholars and a prince — and it is not clear if they have been charged.

title: Italy, Going It Alone, Stalls the Flow of Migrants. But at What Cost?
summary: Some charge that Rome’s solution to the crisis may be strengthening Libya’s most rapacious warlords, while condemning thousands to misery.

title: The Contradiction Buried in Trump’s Iran and North Korea Policies
summary: The president calls the Iran nuclear deal an “embarrassment,” but ending it would destroy his credibility in any talks over North Korea’s arsenal.

title: Pressure Mounts on Iraqi Kurds to Cancel Independence Vote
summary: In a region where few people agree on anything, neighbors and allies are pressing the Kurds to delay a vote they say could unleash violence.

title: Iraqi Kurds Will Vote on Independence, Recalling Tortured Past
summary: Almost every Kurd in northern Iraq has a family history stained by treachery and dispossession. A vote for independence would be a step toward realizing a national dream.

title: Syrian War Drags On, but Assad’s Future Looks as Secure as Ever
summary: Bashar al-Assad has not declared victory, but no one is left who could oust him, and regional powers increasingly operate as though he is here to stay.

title: As Kurds Celebrate Independence Vote, Neighbors Threaten Military Action
summary: The vote, a milestone in Kurdish aspirations for their own state, was opposed by Iraq, Turkey and Iran, which held military exercises on the border.

title: Saudi Arabia Agrees to Let Women Drive
summary: The monarchy abandoned its driving ban for women, long criticized as an infringement on women’s rights and a drag on the economy and society.

title: After the Vote, Does the Kurdish Dream of Independence Have a Chance?
summary: Iraq’s Kurds voted overwhelmingly for an independent state, but their territory lacks democratic institutions, and their troubled economy is dependent on hostile neighbors.

title: A Nuclear Deal With North Korea May Be Tillerson’s Mission Impossible
summary: The task of bridging the gap between Kim Jong-un and President Trump has fallen largely to the secretary of state. But neither side seems interested.

title: Saudi King, in Russia, Seeks Warmer Ties With a Longtime Foe
summary: King Salman’s trip, the first state visit by a Saudi monarch, is a sign of the shifting dynamics in the Middle East as Russia assumes a greater role.

title: Once Shunned as ‘Drivers,’ Saudi Women Who Fought Ban Now Celebrate
summary: In 1990, 47 women took to the road to demand the right to drive. They paid dearly for it, but they have lived to see the end of the ban.
